008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.ij.overlay;
010
011import java.awt.BasicStroke;
012import java.awt.Color;
013import java.awt.Font;
014import java.awt.Shape;
015import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
016
017import ij.gui.Overlay;
018import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
019import ij.gui.TextRoi;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This is an adapter for ImageJ's {@link Overlay} class to ease the insertion of
024 * AWT {@link Shape} elements.
025 * Shapes are only geometric descriptions but have no stroke width, color
026 * etc. attached. 
027 * These are determined by {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter}'s <strong>current state</strong>
028 * when insertion is done with {@link #addShape(Shape)} (i.e., without explicit
029 * stroke information).
030 * Alternatively, the shape's stroke and color may be explicitly specified by calling 
031 * {@link #addShape(Shape, ColoredStroke)}.
032 * When a shape is inserted into the associated overlay it is converted to an ImageJ
033 * {@link ShapeRoi} instance whose stroke/fill properties are set. 
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * Similarly, text elements can be added using {@link #addText(double, double, String)}
037 * or {@link #addText(double, double, String, Font, Color)}.
038 * </p>
039 * <p>
040 * By default, shapes added to {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter} are automatically translated
041 * by 0.5 units in x/y direction, such that integer coordinates are shifted to pixel
042 * centers. This can be deactivated by using constructor 
043 * {@link #ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay, boolean, boolean)}.
044 * </p>
045 * <p>
046 * <strong>Usage example 1 (adding shapes using stroke/color state):</strong>
047 * </p>
048 * <pre>
049 * ImagePlus im = ...
050 * Overlay oly = new Overlay();
051 * ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
052 * 
053 * ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(0.25, Color.blue));
054 * ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(x1, y1, x2, y2));
055 * ...                  // add more shapes with same stroke
056 * ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(0.4, Color.pink));
057 * ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(x3, y3, x4, y4));
058 * ...                  // add more shapes with same stroke
059 * im.setOverlay(oly);
060 * im.show();</pre>
061 * 
062 * <p>
063 * <strong>Usage example 2 (adding shapes with element-wise stroke/color specification):</strong>
064 * </p>
065 * <pre>
066 * ImagePlus im = ...
067 * Overlay oly = new Overlay();
068 * ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
069 * ColoredStroke mystroke = new ColoredStroke(0.25, Color.blue);
070 * ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(x1, y1, x2, y2), mystroke);
071 * ...                          // add more shapes
072 * im.setOverlay(oly);
073 * im.show();</pre>
074 * 
075 * <p>
076 * <strong>Usage example 3 (adding text):</strong>
077 * </p>
078 * <pre>
079 * ImagePlus im = ...
080 * Overlay oly = new Overlay();
081 * ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
082 * ola.setFont(new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 8));
083 * ola.setTextColor(Color.green);
084 * ola.addText(x, y, "text using current font/color state");
085 * 
086 * ola.addText(x, y, "text with explicit font and color", new Font(Font.SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 10), Color.black);
087 * ...
088 * im.setOverlay(oly);
089 * im.show();</pre>
090 * 
091 * 
092 * @author WB
093 * @version 2022/06/09
094 * 
095 * @see ColoredStroke
096 * @see Shape
097 *
098 */
099public class ShapeOverlayAdapter {
100        
101        public static Color DefaultTextColor = Color.black;
102        public static float DefaultStrokeWidth = 0.5f;
103        public static Font DefaultFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 10);
104        
105        private static final AffineTransform PixelOffsetTransform = new AffineTransform(1, 0, 0, 1, 0.5, 0.5); // AWT transformation!
106        
107        private final boolean antiAlias;
108        private final boolean halfPixelOffset;
109        private final Overlay overlay;
110        
111        private ColoredStroke stroke;
112        private Color textColor = DefaultTextColor;
113        private Font font = DefaultFont;
114        
115
116        
117        // ----------------------------------------------------------
118        
119        public ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay oly, boolean halfPixelOffset, boolean antiAlias) {
120                this.overlay = oly;
121                this.halfPixelOffset = halfPixelOffset;
122                this.antiAlias = antiAlias;
123                this.stroke = makeDefaultStroke();
124        }
125        
126        public ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay oly) {
127                this(oly, true, true);
128        }
129        
130        public ShapeOverlayAdapter() {
131                this(new Overlay());
132        }
133        
134        // ----------------------------------------------------------
135        
136        public ColoredStroke getStroke() {
137                return stroke;
138        }
139        
140        public void setStroke(ColoredStroke stroke) {
141                this.stroke = stroke;
142        }
143        
144        public void setTextColor(Color color) {
145                this.textColor = color;
146        }
147        
148        public void setFont(Font font) {
149                this.font = font;
150        }
151        
152        public Overlay getOverlay() {
153                return this.overlay;
154        }
155        
156        // ----------------------------------------------------------
157        
158        protected ShapeRoi shapeToRoi(Shape s, ColoredStroke stroke) {
159                s = (halfPixelOffset) ? PixelOffsetTransform.createTransformedShape(s) : s;
160                ShapeRoi roi = new ShapeRoi(s);
161                BasicStroke bs = stroke.getBasicStroke();
162                roi.setStrokeWidth(bs.getLineWidth());
163                roi.setStrokeColor(stroke.getStrokeColor());
164                roi.setFillColor(stroke.getFillColor());
165                roi.setStroke(bs);
166                roi.setAntiAlias(antiAlias);
167                return roi;
168        }
169        
170        public void addShape(Shape s) {
171                overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, this.stroke));
172        }
173        
174        public void addShapes(Shape[] shapes) {
175                for (Shape s : shapes) {
176                        overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, this.stroke));
177                }
178        }
179        
180        public void addShape(Shape s, ColoredStroke stroke) {
181                overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, stroke));
182        }
183        
184        public void addShapes(Shape[] shapes, ColoredStroke stroke) {
185                for (Shape s : shapes) {
186                        overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, stroke));
187                }
188        }
189        
190        // TODO: check font/color settings
191        public void addText(double x, double y, String text) {
192                TextRoi troi = new TextRoi(x, y, text, this.font);
193                troi.setStrokeColor(this.textColor);
194                overlay.add(troi);
195        }
196        
197        public void addText(double x, double y, String text, Font font, Color textColor) {
198                TextRoi troi = new TextRoi(x, y, text, font);
199                troi.setStrokeColor(textColor);
200                overlay.add(troi);
201        }
202
203        // ----------------------------------------------------------
204        
205        private static ColoredStroke makeDefaultStroke() {
206                ColoredStroke stroke = new ColoredStroke();
207                stroke.setLineWidth(DefaultStrokeWidth);
208                stroke.setStrokeColor(DefaultTextColor);
209                return stroke;
210        }
211
212}
